Key Match Events: De’Aaron Fox recorded 33 points, six rebounds and six assists.
Domantas Sabonis added 17 points, 16 rebounds and seven assists.
Malik Monk registered 14 points, seven boards and six assists.
Trey Lyles and DeMar DeRozan each added 14 points.
Spencer Dinwiddie scored a season-best 30 points and added six assists.
P.J. Washington had a season-high 28 points.
Sacramento held a commanding 58-36 rebounding advantage.
The Mavericks had a 13-1 edge in blocked shots with Daniel Gafford swatting away five.
Quentin Grimes added 11 points and seven rebounds.
Brandon Williams scored 10 points for the Mavericks.
The Mavericks led 75-66 after a basket by Grimes with 4:56 left in the third quarter before Sacramento ripped off a 17-2 surge to end the period.
Fox’s layup made it 10 straight points for Sacramento as the Kings went up by one with 2:46 left in the third.
Fox sank a jumper with under a second left to give Sacramento an 83-77 lead entering the final stanza.
Lyles buried consecutive 3-pointers early in the fourth quarter to give the Kings a 91-78 advantage with 9:11 left.
Dallas crept within 102-93 on a 3-pointer by Grimes with 3:21 to play.
DeRozan and Fox answered with baskets to push the margin to 13 with 2:09 remaining, and the Kings wrapped up the victory.
Post-Match Reflections: The Kings snapped a season-worst six-game losing streak with a 110-100 victory over the visiting Dallas Mavericks.
It was interim coach Doug Christie’s first win after Mike Brown got fired on Friday.
